intro: Nassauvia brevifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, bright yellow or orange flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Nassauvia brevifolia is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
